text:
Raskolnikov listened intently. 

Razumihin slurred, “I gave Zametov a thrashing. Don’t tell anyone.” 

“Why are they such fools?” Raskolnikov asked. 

Razumihin continued, “Ilya Petrovitch took advantage of your fainting.” 

“I fainted from the heat and paint smell,” Raskolnikov replied. 

Razumihin laughed. “You scared that boy! He nearly convulsed!” 

“Did I?” Raskolnikov smirked. 

“Perfect! You crushed him!” Razumihin grinned. 

“Why did they think I was mad?” Raskolnikov wondered. 

“Not mad, just… too much talk, brother.” 

Silence fell as they walked on.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov learns about the impact of his actions on others while discussing a recent incident with Razumihin.
